intro: Trichocentrum × crispiluridum, commonly known as the curly-leaf orchid, is a hybrid orchid species native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its long, pendant inflorescences that bear clusters of fragrant, white or pale pink flowers. The plant has strap-like leaves that are often curled or twisted, giving it its common name. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Trichocentrum × crispiluridum is popular among orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
